name: International Congress of Geographic Science Participation Medal
obverse: Personifications of Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas are gathered around a plinth. Behind them is a tree. There is a boat and cart behind the people. All within beaded border.
reverse: Laurel wreath with raised central field.
reverse_inscriptions: SOCIÉTÉ DE GÉOGRAPHIE FONDÉE A PARIS EN 1821
description: The edge of the medal is stamped with a bee and the word 'CUIVRE'.
The congress, originally scheduled for the spring of 1875, had to be delayed because the original venue was too
small to hold all of the participants. The congress ran from 1-11 August 1875 and was held in the Tuileries.
